p: The relationship between L. nivalis and the primary Agave species it pollinates has never been examined from a climate change perspective. The incorporation of data on potential range shifts of this pollinator and the key food resources could well indicate a more dire scenario for the persistence of L. nivalis over time as well as for the agave species it pollinates. We analysed potential effects of climate change on the geographic distribution of agaves and L. nivalis for the years 2050 and 2070, using ensemble climate models and multiple radiative forcing scenarios from the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change. Changes in distributions as a result of climate change could reduce the available foraging resources and affect the population viability of the endangered bat as well as the pollination service they provide.
